Count distinct elements for each level of hierarchy per sample

Source: R/AnalysisConfiguration.R
hierarchy_counts_sample.Rd

Count distinct elements for each level of hierarchy per sample

hierarchy_counts_sample(pdata, configuration)

Arguments

pdata

data.frame

config

AnalysisConfiguration

See also

Other summary: INTERNAL_FUNCTIONS_BY_FAMILY, hierarchy_counts(), nr_B_in_A_per_sample(), summarize_hierarchy()

Examples




bb <- prolfqua_data('data_ionstar')$filtered()
#> Column added : nr_peptide_Id_IN_protein_Id
bb$config <- old2new(bb$config)
config <- bb$config$clone(deep=TRUE)
data <- bb$data

res <- hierarchy_counts_sample(data, config)
res()
#> # A tibble: 20 × 4
#> # Groups:   isotope [1]
#>    isotope sampleName protein_Id peptide_Id
#>    <chr>   <chr>           <int>      <int>
#>  1 light   a~10              154       1021
#>  2 light   a~11              152       1006
#>  3 light   a~20              153        992
#>  4 light   a~21              155        982
#>  5 light   b~02              158       1047
#>  6 light   b~09              158       1029
#>  7 light   b~12              155       1043
#>  8 light   b~19              155        989
#>  9 light   c~03              160       1042
#> 10 light   c~08              157       1019
#> 11 light   c~13              155       1011
#> 12 light   c~18              159       1018
#> 13 light   d~04              159       1060
#> 14 light   d~07              160       1038
#> 15 light   d~14              160       1032
#> 16 light   d~17              160       1043
#> 17 light   e~05              158       1054
#> 18 light   e~06              161       1046
#> 19 light   e~15              158       1023
#> 20 light   e~16              157       1021
res("long")
#> # A tibble: 40 × 4
#> # Groups:   isotope [1]
#>    isotope sampleName key           nr
#>    <chr>   <chr>      <chr>      <int>
#>  1 light   a~10       protein_Id   154
#>  2 light   a~11       protein_Id   152
#>  3 light   a~20       protein_Id   153
#>  4 light   a~21       protein_Id   155
#>  5 light   b~02       protein_Id   158
#>  6 light   b~09       protein_Id   158
#>  7 light   b~12       protein_Id   155
#>  8 light   b~19       protein_Id   155
#>  9 light   c~03       protein_Id   160
#> 10 light   c~08       protein_Id   157
#> # … with 30 more rows
res("plot")
